name: Photographer/ Videographer
desct: Photographer/ VideographerMovers & ShakersApplyExperience:0-1 yearsLevel:BeginnerTotal Positions:1Job Type:full-timeSalary:Rs.15000- Rs.20000Education:Bachelor DegreeLocation:, NepalApply Before:2019-09-13Cinematographers work alongside Multimedia Adviser and Content Creator to give projects their own unique aesthetic style. Responsible for managing the camera and lighting, they oversee the selection and manipulation of technical equipment to create striking images on screen.The visual impact of a project is driven by the creative choices a cinematographer makes. These guys make the big decisions about the use of different lenses, filters, lighting techniques and camera movements to create dramatic effect and prompt different emotional responses from the audience. They’re also responsible for making decisions about aspect ratio, digital effects, image contrast, and frame rates.Cinematographers get involved throughout the entire production lifecycle. Before filming starts, they dissect the screenplay, conduct extra research into different styles and motifs which relate to the subject matter of the script, and liaise with the Multimedia Adviser and Content Creators to discuss their creative ideas.The next step involves meticulously planning the technical execution of each shot. They also figure out what equipment and staff will be required. They are then responsible for handling the procurement of equipment and other technical production specialists. Throughout this process, cinematographers need to be mindful of budget restrictions and time constraints.During filming, cinematographers run the show, directing the technical production crew and making sure the correct lenses, filters, cranes, Steadicams, dollies and lights are used for each shot.Post-production, cinematographers work alongside directors and editors to make sure the colour grading of the film or TV show is spot on.Apply

name: Technical Engineer
desct:
Technical EngineerYouth Innovation LabApplyExperience:0-1 yearsLevel:IntermediateTotal Positions:1Job Type:full-timeSalary:Rs.40,000- Rs.70,000Education:Bachelor DegreeLocation:,Apply Before:2019-08-30National Emergency Operation Center (NEOC) is leading and facilitating an integrated and common Disaster Management Information Portal of Nepal in close coordination and collaboration with ministries, departments, humanitarian agencies, and private sectors working on disaster risk management and information technology. To support the initiative, YI-Lab, being one of the technical partners, would request application from qualified individuals for the post of Technical Engineer.
Under the direct supervision of designated Officer of NEOC, the Technical Engineer will actively engage with existing partners in the development of integrated Disaster Information Management System (DIMS) locally named as Building Information Platform Against Disaster (BIPAD). The officer will spend 75% of his/her work at the Government of Nepal, Ministry of Home Affairs (MoHA), National Emergency Operation Center (NEOC) and 25% at its partner organizations.
Success in the position will bring about a user friendly reliable BIPAD system and maintenance of strong relationship stakeholders. As the position requires frequent interaction with all project partners and project teams, the job holder will be strategically positioned within the organization to inform, advise and act on behalf of all project teams.
Responsibilities and duties of the Technical Engineer are as follows:
1) Coordinate overall technical development of BIPAD. Understand the priority of NEOC and work with the technical team to make required changes.
2) Strengthen technical capacity of BIPAD to related agencies.
3) Break the overall tasks into smaller activities, develop and implement action plan and assign each activity to key technical personnel.
4) Assign deadlines, create milestones, devise plans to achieve the milestones, and prepare reports required.
5) Give routine updates about the project to stakeholders.
6) Understand the requirements and translate those requirements to the developers as per approved action plan.
7) Set up, monitor, and manage the project management tools (such as Slack/Trello/JIRA) and ensure that it is up to date.
8) Be able to make necessary changes requested by MoHA/NEOC on BIPAD.
9) Keep track of log book and implementation plan of system development and oversee the progress.
10) Be able to solve technical issues of backend, frontend, and GIS independently when required.
11) Actively involved in localization of BIPAD at province and local level.
Qualifications we are looking for include:
1) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or similar disciplines.
2) Experience in developing and managing MIS.
3) Good development experience in Python, Django framework, Javascript.
4) Comfortable working and making changes in React framework, and Geoserver platform.
5) Comfortable making modifications in HTML, CSS, and working with third party javascript libraries as per need.
6) Know how of continuous integration, continuous deployment pipeline, git version controlling, docker based deployment.
7) Experience in developing with, and managing Geospatial servers.
8) Open to learning new concepts and experimenting.
9) Fluent in Nepali and English.
10) Be physically fit to travel around Nationally and Internationally.
Send in your cover letter and CV to the following email address:[email protected](also cc[email protected])System AdministrationServerInformation SecurityApply
